version_description:
•Added ability to export metadata from photos and videos. This is useful if you have a single photo/video that you want to use as a metadata template for other photos/videos.

•Added ability to view metadata directly from Apple Photos and other apps via the action/share button.

•Added ability to view filename and size of photos and videos.

•View duration and resolution of videos.

•Enhanced the date selector to allow all fields, year-month-day-hour-minute-and second to be set.

•Enhanced the date selector to start at the currently set date of the field, instead of todays date.

P.S. - If you like the app, please rate 5 stars

Bug fixes
Bug fixes
Added ability to select between standard map or satellite map display mode.
Added ability to select between standard map or satellite map display mode.

○Fixed bug that prevented setting TIFF image description and PNG metadata on certain photos
○Now displays format and codec when viewing video metadata
○Fix crash when viewing slow motion videos, and other bug fixes

○Fixed bug that prevented setting TIFF image description and PNG metadata on certain photos
○Now displays format and codec when viewing video metadata
○Fix crash when viewing slow motion videos, and other bug fixes

○Fixed issue where schema was not saving latitude and longitude
○Fixed issue where editable video metadata was present but not displaying when editing an existing video's metadata
○Other bug fixes

○Fixed issue where schema was not saving latitude and longitude
○Fixed issue where editable video metadata was present but not displaying when editing an existing video's metadata
○Other bug fixes

•Finally, one of the most requested features is now here... modify photo and video metadata directly, without creating a copy!!
-see the new "Settings" menu option to chose your preference
•To set photo or video date and time that iOS uses to sort photos, select the new field "Creation Date" under "Apple File Properties"
•Renamed one of the metadata export options from "raw" to "blob" in order to not confuse this with the RAW image file types
•Other stability enhancements

•Finally, one of the most requested features is now here... modify photo and video metadata directly, without creating a copy!!
-see the new "Settings" menu option to chose your preference
•To set photo or video date and time that iOS uses to sort photos, select the new field "Creation Date" under "Apple File Properties"
•Renamed one of the metadata export options from "raw" to "blob" in order to not confuse this with the RAW image file types
•Other stability enhancements

•Finally, one of the most requested features is now here... overwrite photo and video metadata directly, without creating a copy!!
-see the new "Settings" menu option to chose your preference. Note: overwriting is only compatible with JPEG photos and MOV videos.
•To set photo or video date and time that iOS uses to sort photos, select the new field "Creation Date" under "Apple File Properties"
•Renamed one of the metadata export options from "raw" to "blob" in order to not confuse this with the RAW image file types
•Other stability enhancements

•Finally, one of the most requested features is now here... overwrite photo and video metadata directly, without creating a copy!!
-see the new "Settings" menu option to chose your preference. Note: overwriting is only compatible with JPEG photos and MOV videos.
•To set photo or video date and time that iOS uses to sort photos, select the new field "Creation Date" under "Apple File Properties"
•Renamed one of the metadata export options from "raw" to "blob" in order to not confuse this with the RAW image file types
•Other stability enhancements
Fixed bug that prevented some photos to process edits
Fixed bug that prevented some photos to process edits
Fix bug that caused app to crash or not process remove all metadata or remove gps
Fix bug that caused app to crash or not process remove all metadata or remove gps

Thank you for purchasing and using Metadata Pro. This updates includes the following:
•Display video duration as X hours, Y minutes, Z seconds
•Display photo/video size as B, KB, or MB depending on size
•Move toolbar items to the right, to allow easier reach from larger screens or when using app in landscape mode
•Bug fixes and stability enhancements
•More updates on the way

P.S. If you have issues or suggestions, please report them to support@platinumcityapps.com. Use the "Email Us" menu item to contact us. Please provide as much detail as you can, should you experience a bug.

If you like this app, please rate 5 stars on the app store. Your positive reviews really help us, and help other people know how useful this app is. Use the "Rate" menu item to quickly open the App Store listing.

○Now displaying filename in the navigation bar of the photo view, as well as the Processing status HUD
○Selecting photos and videos will now show a number instead of checkmark
○Bug fix to detect if non-JPEG photos are going to be overwritten or copy-modified

•Added TIFF Software field to editable metadata fields
•Exporting to metadata blob has been removed - export to metadata schema is still available
•Metadata blobs will be soon be completely removed to make the app easier to use

•Added TIFF Software field to editable metadata fields
•Exporting to metadata blob has been removed - export to metadata schema is still available
•Metadata blobs will be soon be completely removed to make the app easier to use
Batch processing with dates now supports interval time increments. The interval property for date fields has been added next to the date and time scroll picker.
Batch processing with dates now supports interval time increments. The interval property for date fields has been added next to the date and time scroll picker.

This update fixes a couple issues:

1. The map search feature stopped working after Google changed how their service works. The app is no longer relying on Google for map searches and is now using Apple maps.

2. A recent update to iOS prevents removing GPS/location on photo overwrites. Removal of GPS/location is still possible on new/created photos. So, now the app will prompt to confirm to edit as a new photo in cases where GPS/location is to be removed.

This update fixes a couple issues:

1. The map search feature stopped working after Google changed how their service works. The app is no longer relying on Google for map searches and is now using Apple maps.

2. A recent update to iOS prevents removing GPS/location on photo overwrites. Removal of GPS/location is still possible on new/created photos. So, now the app will prompt to confirm to edit as a new photo in cases where GPS/location is to be removed.

•Batch editing has been greatly optimized so now you only need to confirm one time when editing a batch of photos.
•Added a feature to shift photo creation dates by any any time frame you desire. Select the "Creation Date Shift" field to shift your creation dates. Now, for example, you can shift the dates of a batch of photos by 5 hours.

•Batch editing has been greatly optimized so now you only need to confirm one time when editing a batch of photos.
•Added a feature to shift photo creation dates by any any time frame you desire. Select the "Creation Date Shift" field to shift your creation dates. Now, for example, you can shift the dates of a batch of photos by 5 hours.
